tr.td: Cactus has a new cool web-site. You can write your comments to the Cactus mailing list.
Cactus 1.7.1 has been released. Full details can be found in the release announcement.
Cactus now has a nice banner that you can use on your web site if you wish to show your support to the Cactus project. Thanks Eoghan for the design.
Our previous logo was nice and we thank Lyonel Thouvenot for designing it. However change is good and Eoghan McIlwaine has designed a new logo for us! Thanks Eoghan.
Cactus 1.7 has been released. Full details can be found in the release announcement.

Christian Sell has started a new framework called AppServerUnit. Its principle seems very similar to Cactus in that it also uses a server interception approach in order to run JUnit test cases on the server side. It focuses only on EJB and has some client side tools to create test-instrumented EARs.
Olexiy Prohorenko has published a nice tutorial article explaining how to use Cactus to test EJBs.
Piran Montford has created a Cactus extension to help use Cactus with ATG Dynamo.
The Cargo project has just started. The goal is to extract the code to start/stop/configure containers from the Cactus Ant integration and make it a standalone project.
Julien explains how to test struts application with Cactus.

JAM is a modular Ant toolkit for developing and testing Java/J2EE applications. JAM supports EJB and Servlet/JSP development using XDoclet, JUnit, Cactus, Maven, Castor and MDA/UML code generation on various J2EE servers including JBoss. There is a tutorial showing how to test EJBs with Cactus. For more information see also the release information.
Cactus 1.6.1 has been released. Full details can be found in the release announcement.
Cactus 1.6 has been released. Full details can be found in the release announcement.
Vincent is proposing a new architecture for Cactus v2. We have set up a wiki page to discuss it. There is some start at implementing it in Cactus CVS in the scratchpad area.
There is now a new Cactus wiki. This new wiki is based on MoinMoin. All changes go to the cactus-dev mailing list.
